snippet: The move came in response to a lawsuit filed by the Nez Perce tribe and an environmental group, which charged that the Forest Service failed to enforce its own rules to protect the environment through the corridor.
abstract: Federal Judge B Lynn Winmill orders halt to more shipments of immense loads of oil field equipment through national forest in Idaho, pending a broad review of effects on the route; review will be conducted by the United States Forest Service in consultation with the Nez Perce Indians, whose tribal rights and lands near the forest route were central to judge's ruling.
lead_paragraph: The move came in response to a lawsuit filed by the Nez Perce tribe and an environmental group, which charged that the Forest Service failed to enforce its own rules to protect the environment through the corridor.

headline.main: Judge Blocks Shipment of Oil Equipment Through Idaho Forest
headline.print_headline: Judge Blocks Shipment of Oil Equipment Through Idaho Forest
